instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message:
Hi, 


Got this iMac. First it was damaged power supply, then L7150 was completly burnt. Replace them bot and there were some lines with wrong componentes on it. Replaced and repaird all them and now i am getting LED 1 on. But still not booting machine. 



When try to boot pressing button led 1 turns off and turns on again. Checked Power lines for S5-S3 and seems all ok. 


I am not getting sys good because of missing PM_SLP_S5_L,  Checked SMC and seems to be ok. Anyway reballed it. Still not spinning fans.

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message:
Check PCH_DSWVRMEN and all PCH's RTC signals.

Post PM_RSMRST_PCH_L and PM_PWRBTN_L levels.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L as same moment.

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message:
PCH_DSWVRMEN  3.2V
PM_RSMRST_PCH_L  3.2V
PM_PWRBTN_L  3.4V  dropping when trigger smc_ONOFF_L

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message: Then check for high pulse at all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals, at same time...

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message: will check it now. Do you know if CPU is dead will it do that with 1st led? Will i get sys power good if CPU is removed?

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message: PCH/CPU not involved in S5 state generation...

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message: no high pulse on PM_SLP_S... triggerring smc_onoff_l

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message:
Is not the first time when I mention about these signals; 4 (four) in total, apart of 32KHz clock.
Look at U1100 RTC block on page 11.

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message:
WHY?
Did you check mentioned signals?
These are inputs, required by PCH to start power on sequence...

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message: will check it on monday. thanks

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message:
Ok,

So:

PCH_SRTCRST_L - 3.3V
PCH_INTRUDER_L - 3V
PCH_INTVRMEN_L - 3.2V
RTC_RESET_L - 3.3V



u mean this?

threads.title: 820-4652-A iMac 27 not starting.
threads.message:
There is separate PCH (U1100) and shouldn't be affected by L7150 overvoltage.
But if CPU (U0500) has been damaged this way, still exists a low "chance" it affected PCH too.

If you do NOT get at least a pulse at PM_SLP_S5_L, or PM_SLP_S4_L when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L, that points to a bad PCH...
